meanings.definition: A tool used for holding a piece of work in a lathe or for marking it out.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used the rynds to secure the wood in place on the lathe.
meanings.sent2: The machinist carefully positioned the rynds to mark the measurements on the metal piece.
meanings.sent3: When the rynds went missing, the workshop turned into chaos.
meanings.sent4: His precision with the rynds was like a conductor leading an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The shiny rynds gleamed under the workshop lights, ready for action.

meanings.definition: A piece of metal in the form of a segment of a disk, used in a rolling mill to shape metal.
meanings.sent1: The rynds in the rolling mill helped shape the metal into sheets.
meanings.sent2: Each rynds played a crucial role in the metal shaping process.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous apprentice tried to juggle the heavy rynds, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The rynds transformed the raw metal like a sculptor shaping clay.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic clinking of the rynds against the metal created a mesmerizing melody in the workshop.
